A Bargain in Fashion

A cluttered room, Raskolnikov looks unimpressed.  
“Why wear old things?” he thinks.  

‘Look at these breeches, Rodya!’  
‘They’re worn out!’  
‘Worn is better! Trust me!’  

---
A sunny street, a pair of trousers displayed proudly.  
“Summer means fresh styles,” he beams.  

‘Two roubles twenty-five copecks! A steal!’  
‘But they’ll wear out fast!’  
‘That’s the point! Another suit next year!’

**PAGE SUMMARY:** The conversation revolves around the purchase of second-hand clothing, emphasizing the practicality and cost-effectiveness of buying worn items.
